text: some MHE folks would have legacied access to the webhook action
<@U05786NSSH2> I'd love to hear more about what kinds of tokens you'd add to the URL field and how it would be helpful to what you're trying to do :smile:

We are trying to use the Flow Execution API in a omnichannel application that we use.

Endpoint URL: POST/flows/{flowId}/contact/{contactId}/exec

API documentation (Flows): <https://developers.huggy.io/pt/API/api-v2.html#post-chats-id-flow>
cool thank you! we are working our way toward a future where variables can be used in all workflow fields. I've put this on the teams radar as one to look into.

Hello Everyone,

I’m developing a custom code that that is triggered by a webhook and should retrieve newly created contact and associated company after user submits the form.
but I’m confused about which event I should subscribe to, considering that company.creation and contact.creation events come in random order. Additionally I would like to update the company (on my side) with new contact if there is another form submission and HubSpot associates new contact to company created in previous submission.

What would be the best approach in this situation?
